comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: Most likely George Hannauer (born 19 Dec 1872 in ST. LOUIS MISSOURI, died 02 Nov 1929 in MASSACHUSETTS), President of the Boston and Maine Railroad. familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/c/h/a/John-T-Chandler... Hannauer co-invented the retarder switch, a train brake laid on a track which controls the speed cars can reach when being reclassified into new freight trains (according to www.mechanicville.com/DocumentCenter/Home/View/40) In 1917, nineteen railroads were affected by a strike of switchmen in the Chicago yards. G. Hannauer was the chairman of a conference committee of the general managers of these railroads. See the New-York tribune., July 30, 1917, Page 14, first column
